page.title: 05COTTAM VILLAGE
page.content: I live at Cottam near on of the biggest Power Stations in the country, which is one of many built along the banks of the River Trent. It makes my house small. Sometimes at night it lets out a sudden burst of steam which deafens you. We have a lot of animals including six cats, two dogs and four guinea pigs. My dad works at Rampton Hospital as a stoker. He keeps steam engines and showing is a family interest. We also have a classic bus which we take to rallies every weekend. My hobbies are engines and playing football. There is nothing much to do for children in the village. I travel to school by mini-bus.
